alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 21 at 8:28AM MDT until April 22 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 to 12 inches, locally up to 15 inches in the upper Cottonwoods. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...From noon today to 9 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected, particularly near and after sunset. The heaviest snow rates are expected between 3 PM and 9 PM including Big and Little Cottonwood Canyons. There is also the potential for accumulating snow through Parleys Canyon during the Friday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
